fields.description:
I noticed that when the POST is made, the headers don't set the\\
content type correctly.

It should be Content-Type: application/json\\
Instead it is Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded

Meaning the receiving has to interpret that the data is a JSON encoded dataset.

Is there any way to set the content type correctly?

Also is there any way to limit the output to a single branch?
fields.summary: Allow Setting of Content-Type on POST Links (BB-9380)

fields.description: Instead of going through the rigamarole of editing the issue, I should be able to just click an "Assign to me" button on the issue page.
fields.summary: "Assign to me" button on the issue screen (BB-9384)

fields.description: Currently only those projects owned by the team explicitly, are shown on the Team page. It will be really nice if even the projects where the team has access (but not owned by team) can be shown.
fields.summary: Ability to see all projects shared with team

fields.description:
* Browse to the "Username aliases" settings page for a repo
* Note the number of users in the list
* Click on a navigation link ("Hooks" for example)
* Use the browsers back button and notice that the list of users have replicated and will continue to do so if you browse to another page and then use the back button again.
fields.summary: Navigating away and back to username aliases causes list entries to replicate
Can't download PDF files with custom domain (BB-9391)

fields.description:
The filesearch dialog ("f" shortcut) seems to work well, until you switch branches, then it just displays the "spinner" icon and no file results.

Steps to reproduce:

# View source for master (or any branch) in Bitbucket
# Hit "f" and search for a file path - works fine.
# Pop down the branch submenu on the Source page (without reloading) and select a different branch to view
# Hit "f" and search again - the "spinner" icon just displays endlessly and no results are shown.

This is confirmed on Chrome 29.0.1547 on Mac and Safari 6.0.5 on the Mac
fields.summary: File search doesn't work after switching branches (BB-9387)

fields.description:
For example the full message is:

resolved BCLOUD-774. When an user update his name, the assignee dropdown should\\
be updated correctly too.\\
The compare function in User/Iteration class follows the rules:

# If the uid is the same, return zero.
# Else, order by name\\
So if name updated, we can't find the old pos unless we use the old name.\\
The current solution is to iterate the whole list to find the match using uid\\
and then update the name.

but the hook gave our server is:

"resolved BCLOUD-774. When an user update his name, the assignee dropdown should be ..."

Is this a feature or a bug?\\
I think it's better to give full message to user. Then user can decide how long they needed.
fields.summary: The message in commit hook is not full commit message. (BB-9435)

fields.description: I was invited into a repository, but I did not receive any message about it and cannot access it. Inviting again does not seem to work (It says I'm already invited). The repository in question is https://bitbucket.org/Sord/surgery-positions

Could you guys take a look and give us some info on what happened?   Thanks!

fields.description:
When pushing "Create Branch" button on a JIRA Issue, it would be nice to configure the branch name to have a default prefix (like features/ as per gitflow).  I imagine this feature would be a configuration open in BitBucket, not JIRA either way would be fine.

It should also use the configured "main branch" of the repo for "Branch from".

(I recall seeing something like at the Summit 2013, but perhaps that was on Stash instead.)
fields.summary: Default branch name prefix from JIRA (BB-9390)

fields.description:
I am using Mercurial Bitbucket to collaboratively work on LaTeX and markdown documents. For those kind of documents the diff viewer is not optimal as it - for good reasons - is optimised for code.

These kind of text documents tend to have very long lines (one paragraph) with small changes in them. For them rewrapping the text and highlighting which words (delimited by spaces) changed, is very helpful. See, for example, what meld does.

It would be great if there was an option to select a text-optimised-diff-viewer.
fields.summary: Diff Viewer for Written Text (BB-9383)

fields.description:
Hi, I'm getting the error 500\\
Something went wrong. When I tried to access to repositories. thanks in advance, (d2f353366bd04337aa708fa403801513) or (b516bb092bf74c41ba4ceadb7ac688a0)\\
It is happen from at least two weeks, anyway  I'm using the Sourcetree, and working OK.
fields.summary: Error 500 clicking in repositories (BB-9374)

fields.description:
I imported all my repositories from Github and somehow Bitbucket automatically detected that one of them was a fork of an existing repository. Except that in my feed it labeled that earlier repository as a fork of mine.

Then I went through and cleaned out the repositories that I didn't want on this account.

And I mindlessly clicked through to the (owned by someone else) "forked" one, to delete it after deleting the repository that I imported that bitbucket thought had been forked.

And unfortunately I think it worked.

Here are the entries from my activity (in reverse chronological order, as listed):\\
38 Zeros\\
38 Zeros deleted keyvanfatehi/followingrobot\\
11 minutes ago\\
38 Zeros\\
38 Zeros deleted 38zeros/followingrobot\\
11 minutes ago

And here are the entries from the other account's activity:\\
38 Zeros deleted keyvanfatehi/followingrobot\\
11 minutes ago

And the repository is not listed at:\\
https://bitbucket.org/keyvanfatehi/profile/repositories

Keep in mind I don't know if it ever was listed there -- I have no relation to the other account holder other than I forked one of their repositories on Github.
fields.summary: I deleted a repository that I shouldn't have been allowed to.

fields.description:
Attached is a screenshot of the latest instance of the unreliability of closing/resolving issues via commit messages.

It seems fairly random but at times the keywords simply don't work. I've also found that if you put the commands at the end of the message or further down (not in the first line) the unreliable nature increases greatly.

Example:

{code}
Fixed broken divs and other such things, fixing BCLOUD-34
Completed IE8 bugfix for buttons, close BCLOUD-12
At this point in my messages, the commands would simply not fire, fixed BCLOUD-45
{code}

I've searched and I seem to be the only one with this issue but I've tried submitting my commits from Tower, Sublime Text 2's Git plugin, and the command line itself with the same results.
fields.summary: Issue tracking commands via commit messages unreliable (BB-9402)

fields.description:
We opened a new team account just yesterday, and today I've been busy inviting people into the system by their email address. They're all receiving the email ok, but the actual link that needs to be click is virtually invisible for some of them.

One of them said specifically: "I upgraded to MS Office 2013, and in Outlook, all of the links were not showing.  Thankfully, in the web outlook version, they do."

Most of the email formats correctly, but the link goes to the bottom-left of the box it sits in, is missing its background and the text color is white.
fields.summary: Team invitations emails are misformatted in Outlook (BB-9366)

fields.description:
Gave me the following error code which "might be useful"\\
a7db18101f1346f18cdb5b1027b0bdd5
fields.summary: 500 Server error on Private Repo Creation

fields.description:
I'm setting up a workflow where each developer has his own fork on Bitbucket. He pushes his changesets there and issue a pull request for someone to review the changesets before merging them back into the main repository.

It would therefore be helpful if the pull request screen would default to the main repo as the pull request destination. The named branch should also be kept as is: if I make a change on the {{stable}} branch in my repo, I want the change to be on the {{stable}} branch in the main repo too.

Generally, I think it makes little sense to issue cross-named branch pull requests with Mercurial. For Git or when using Mercurial bookmarks it makes a lot of sense, but named branches are meant for long-term branches where you don't merge on a per-feature basis.
fields.summary: Pull requests should go back to forked-from repo by default (BB-9378)

fields.description:
When I enter a query in the Bitbucket issue tracker, I get back issues without a filter on status. I normally want to see open or new issues. If I click the buttons for that, I lose my query and I end up hacking the URL by hand.

In other words: creating a query for open issues mentioning "something" should be considered an advanced query — it's an everyday thing.
fields.summary: Issue tracker should keep query when filtering by status (BB-9371)

fields.description: ... would be better
fields.summary: Can issues be tagged and/or be assigned to categories/folders?
[deleted]

fields.description:
Hello,

When we first started our eval of JIRA on demand and linked BitBucket all was well.

However recently it's not been.

When I commit to BitBucket I use JIRA codes such as MBIDS-66 and then add #Comment This is my comment.

This used to work, and it would add the comment directly to that issue, no longer though and this would be very useful to have back.

https://bitbucket.org/hydradevelopment/miniaturebids/commits/afa66e102079570a310fb6e553a5be2fdf8f3714

That should have updated a number of calls with a comment but even though each shows the commit against them, none of them have the comment.

It broke when my colleague modified the work flow and added in more stages that an issue can be in.

So can you point out what's wrong please.

Thanks
fields.summary: BitBucket commits show against issues, but the commited #comments don't.

fields.description:
i'd like the ability to disable the "inherit permissions" checkbox when forking a repository.

if disabling it isn't an option, i'd like it to not be checked by default.

i often forget to do so, and as result, have to spam everyone on my team when i remove their permissions.

example:

!http://i.imgur.com/saIktOl.png!
fields.summary: "Inherit permissions" should default to unchecked when forking (BB-9382)

fields.description:
I just noticed that issues aren't closed on push if the commit message contains "Closes BCLOUD-1".

I guess it's simply because "closes" is not a valid hook. While "fixes" and "resolves" are present in the list at https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BITBUCKET/Resolve+issues+automatically+when+users+push+code - "closes" is not.

It would be super useful to allow this form of the "close" word to work, since that would match "fix" and "resolve".
fields.summary: Please add "Closes #xxx" present form verb to Issues hook (BB-9361)

fields.description:
Example of the behaviour can be seen [here|https://api.bitbucket.org/2.0/repositories/xarthisius/rest_test/pullrequests/1/patch]

where you get:

{code}
#!diff
--- /dev/null
+++ b/pelny.txt
@@ -0,0 +1,1 @@
+blababab
{code}

instead of

{code}
#!diff
diff --git a/pelny.txt b/pelny.txt
new file mode 100644
--- /dev/null
+++ b/pelny.txt
@@ -0,0 +1,1 @@
+blababab
diff --git a/pusty.txt b/pusty.txt
new file mode 100644
{code}

It is troublesome for Python projects which tend to use things like empty {{__init__.py}} a lot. This breaks our CI as {{patch -p1 < REST_patch}} fails to create everything properly. I guess this is caused by using just {{hg diff}}, possible solution is to switch to using {{hg diff --git -U 1}} internally.
fields.summary: Pull Request REST API-2.0 doesn't generate diff for empty files in Mercurial (BB-8785)

fields.description:
I frequently share urls with team members who are logged into bitbucket.   It seems very weird that they have to change the username on the urls.

Perhaps I'm missing some obvious setting to fix this, but I did check the documentation.   Perhaps this is a documentation bug and it should be more obvious on how to fix this?
fields.summary: urls without usernames

fields.description: defa6531aa6341b68754b311abd54c0a

fields.description:
When I try to update the reviewers on a pull request, the "Update pull request" button stays inactive. I removed a reviewer and added another, but it says "There are no changes".

Strangely, there are changes (in the form of changesets to be merged) when I view the pull request, but they disappear on the edit page. There are no bookmarks involved here: just two repositories where a branch {{X}} has more commits in my repository than in the main repository.
fields.summary: Cannot update pull request reviewers

fields.description:
I created branch "task-1" from branch "master", did some changes then committed and pushed those.

It went all fine when doing this on sourcetree. But then when I go on BitBucket, I did a Pull Request. There I noticed that a conflict was notified.

I thought I did a mistake when using sourcetree. Looked at my commit, then reset my commit and try again. Same issue!

In the end, I could not find why BitBucket would signal a conflict. And I thought "ok, let's try to merge the "task-1" branch into "master" branch locally, maybe I'll be able to fix the conflict locally more easily somehow. Surprise: no conflict had to be resolved locally, "task-1" merged smoothly into "master" branch.

See attached screenshot for conflict on BitBucket
fields.summary: Merge marked as conflict on BitBucket when there is no conflict shown in sourcetree (BB-9381)
submodules lost their folder icon (BB-9347)

Thanks in advance

Regards\\
Juan

fields.description:
In repository settings I've try to change project logo but clicking on link or logo acts as simple link to *https://bitbucket.org/user/repo/admin#change-logo* but no any dialog appear

Tested on *Firefox 24* (both Linnux and Windows) and *Opera 16*

fields.description: When I log in go my repo (bitbucket.org/trijezdci) on my Mac, I get an edit button when viewing source files and I can edit them. However, when I log in to my repo on my iPad, I don't get the edit button and consequently I can't edit the source files, although I was able to do so some time ago. Also, there is nothing visible on the page that says that I am logged in, although I must be logged in because I can edit issues and change settings on my profile. It is almost like I am logged in but I am not.
fields.summary: Keyboard does not pop up on Online Edit on iPad (BB-9619)

fields.description: The dropdown with repo names on https://bitbucket.org/branch/create should be wider to accommodate large repository names. Currently there's no way to select the correct one.  Attached sample image.
fields.summary: Long repository names are indistinguishable in create branch dropdown (BB-9353)

fields.description:
Although I linked a repository (https://bitbucket.org/jamesii/main) to a JIRA instance (https://altair.informatik.uni-rostock.de/jira), the repository's issue tracker page (https://bitbucket.org/jamesii/main/issues) displays a button to create a new issue, instead of a URL to the linked JIRA instance.

Currently, it seems there are only two options:

* disable the built-in issue tracker and hope users find the link to JIRA elsewhere
* keep the built-in issue tracker, so there are now two places to submit issues

Ideally, Bitbucket users would be forwarded to the linked JIRA instance, or (more generally) a custom URL to an external issue tracker could be displayed.
fields.summary: Linked JIRA instance should be integrated on issue tracker page

fields.description:
I'm uploading UTF-8 enconded codes to Bitbucket. Although I'm able to read everything correctly in the Bitbucket website (see image attached), when I download the code to my local machine I'm getting special characters wrongly converted (see image attached).

Is there any way to fix it?
fields.summary: Wrong UTF-8 characters

fields.description:
{{PUT https://bitbucket.org/api/1.0/repositories/{accountname}/{repo_slug}/issues/{issue_id}}} let you add and modify milestones attached to an issue but there seems to be missing an option to set it null.

Related documentation:

* [Update an existing issue|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BITBUCKET/issues%2BResource#issuesResource-Updateanexistingissue]
* [GET the defined milestones|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BITBUCKET/issues%2BResource%3Fsrc%3Dsearch#issuesResource-GETthedefinedmilestones]
fields.summary: Cannot remove issue milestone through API (BB-9350)

fields.description: When I try to upload a file to a repository's download section while making the request from a custom domain, an XHR request is made to {{http:///site/mimeguess/}}, which returns a 404 Not Found error. The value of the hidden Content-Type field is then set to the contents of the 404 page. The 404 page also appears to be the initial value of that field once the page is loaded, according to Firefox's inspector. Changing the value of the Content-Type field to {{application/octet-stream}} before submitting the form does not work, as the request to mimeguess is made after I click the submit button. After the form submission completes, Amazon S3 returns: {code} MaxPostPreDataLengthExceeded Your POST request fields preceeding the upload file was too large. 20480 A88397D7396072A9 i1h9kVyPj3QXvFpaQBg4AAR92lhVqdPbbgqv3xrfz7HYvbkFJrch2wTVJfdYMOCl {code} I am using Firefox 24 on Fedora 18 x86_64.
fields.summary: Uploading files on a custom domain results in the contents of a 404 page being sent to S3, leading to a MaxPostPreDataLengthExceeded error (BB-9352)

fields.description: I used to have access to a repo. When my access was revoked, 2 issues were still open for which I was assigned. Now the counter is still on 2 on my dashboard, but I don't have access to delete them.
fields.summary: Cannot remove the issues of a repo I don't have access to anymore (BB-9356)

fields.description:
I have two feature requests that would make this site vastly superior:

1- Open links in a new tab in the issue queue!

2- When you click "my issues" and then "status" it shows you resolved issues first. If it's resolved you probably don't care to see it as much as your UNRESOLVED issues. Can you switch this.
fields.summary: Open external links in issues in a new tab (BB-9399)

fields.description:
During our QA process, whoever is doing the QA will mass input issues with a priority/type/title/description but leave off an assignee as they let us delegate who will fix what.

When we set an issue to Open (compared to Duplicate, Invalid, etc) it would be nice if we could set it to Open and assign it or do pretty much any other task as if we were "editing" the issue.
fields.summary: When transitioning an issue, allow users to select an Assignee as well (BB-9386)

fields.description:
Creating a new repo via rest api and 'no_forks' as true does not work as expected.\\
The forking strategy remains as "Allow only private forks"
fields.summary: Creating a new repo with "no forks" is not working (BB-9372)

fields.description:
I was looking for the BitBucket compare API endpoint, and found this:

https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BITBUCKET/compare+Resources?src=search

From what i can tell, the call is actually implemented despite the lacking\\
documentation. There are some oddities in the response which leads me to\\
belive the implementation is not completed.

Diffs look like repr of python objects:\\
"diff": "<HgDiff a61d18b9db51:3b3ee9df3977\\
['demos/template/content/templates-tenjin/membership/signup.html']>"

Reproduce like this:\\
curl -v\\
https://api.bitbucket.org/1.0/repositories/akorn/wheezy.web/compare/45ab369..3b3ee9d

It would be great to know if BitBucket is committed to supporting this endpoint?
fields.summary: Compare API endpoint

fields.description:
I wrote a Markdown file locally and pushed it to Bitbucket. I navigate to the file in the source browser, but I see an error instead of my content:

"An error occurred while parsing the page."

This file is publically available here:

https://bitbucket.org/chexxor/researchnotes/src/6b3c2822ee30319f38e58de53d1e5b01008c982b/ConferenceNotes/ClassesJimButNotAsWeKnowThem.md?at=master

At first, I assumed my Markdown formatting has a bug. I pasted it into some online Markdown previewers, but they parsed it with no issues. I tried these:

* http://georgeosddev.github.io/markdown-edit/
* http://daringfireball.net/projects/markdown/dingus

Any ideas?
fields.summary: Error viewing Markdown file - "An error occurred while parsing the page."

Error message:

Something went wrong.

You can contact support or create a public issue if the problem persists.\\
This might be useful in debugging the problem:\\
4eb431e15a6348089a66ff704a1a8b12\\
You can also visit our status page.
fields.summary: Unable to sign up or login using Google login

fields.description: During the creation of a repo, a 500 server error was returned (with not status returned). Judging by the fact that the repository URL has been registered, but no repository exists in the location when accessed, an error must have occurred in the actual creation of the repo.
fields.summary: Repo Created, but empty

fields.description:
The list of users and groups in a repo's 'Access Management' page duplicates when navigating to another admin page and returning via the back-button in browser.

Steps to reproduce:

# Visit the Access Management page in a Git repo's administration screen (i.e. https://bitbucket.org/<username>/<reponame>/admin/access) and notice the list of Users and Groups with their respective permissions.
# Browse to any other admin page via the menu on the left.
# Use the browser's 'back' history-command (via back-button or mouse-button) to return to the Access Management page.
# You'll notice the list of Users and Groups has duplicated.

Each repetition of steps 2 & 3 further increases the duplication of the original list of Users and Groups.
fields.summary: List of users and groups in repo's 'Access Management' duplicates when using back-button in browser. (BB-9317)

fields.description:
This is an additional report of this "Invalid" issue. https://bitbucket.org/site/master/issue/5511/commenting-on-large-pull-request-is-very

As above, large pull requests create crippling performance problems in the browser. One of our projects has several pull requests which are so large that even attempting to scroll the page results in a lag of 5+ seconds at times. Typing comments is as bad if not worse.

I cannot link to any of these pull requests as our repo is private, but it appears to be an endemic issue which I deal with on almost every pull request I review. We're using relatively powerful machines (a few years old)
fields.summary: Large pull requests have major browser performance issues (BB-9318)

fields.description:
There has been a lot of discussion when notification spam hits inbox and maybe even emails. The other side of this is that outbox (folder {{Sent}}) is filled with notifications I personally did not send. It looks like someone else has subscribed to some notification which I trigger (like pushing to some repo or replying to an issue) and as a result, I get same notification multiple time into my Sent folder but the recipients just differ.

This makes outbox totally useless because you really need to work hard before you can find any private message you sent to someone.

Example: When I created this issue I got 5 new messages into my Sent folder and all recipients were Bitbucket/Atlassian staff members.
fields.summary: Sent folder in Messages is spammed with notifications (BB-9351)

fields.description:
https://bitbucket.org/nazya/nazya1/pull-request/new    generates 500 error

6718d23af37f4a6686c8409d6fb51b4e

fields.description:
I need to create multiple teams for my projects but their ownership belongs to same guy.

I want to create all teams using that single email address and add different users to individual teams.

If I try to repeat email address for another team I get error message as "<emailAddress>  is already in use by another user."
fields.summary: Unable to use same email address while creating different teams.

fields.description:
I've added a pull request hook to one of my private repos.\\
I can't see the content type {{application/json}} being set in your request + I believe this to be the cause of a few problems I'm having.

The headers which are being set are:

{code}
host:'',
content-length': '395',
accept-encoding: 'gzip, deflate',
authorization: '',
user-agent: 'Bitbucket.org',
x-newrelic-id: '',
x-newrelic-transaction: ''
{code}

I've been referring to the docs on this page:\\
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BITBUCKET/Pull+Request+POST+hook+management

Which state:\\
"The content header of the POST has an application/json type"

Any ideas?\\
thanks
fields.summary: Content Type `application/json` not being set in Pull Request POST (BB-9380)

fields.description: If you have the no public forks option enabled on a repository, the editor's 'fork' function will not work properly when trying to use inline editing.

fields.description: You have to create a Kind/Priority/Component before creating the issue. It would be nice to have an option to "Create new Priority" that gives you a pop up and then you could immediately use that item when creating a new issue. Latest version of Redmine does this quite well.
fields.summary: Ability to create Kind/Priority/Component when creating a new issue

fields.description:
I've noticed that emails sent out as a result of > 1 commits (in a single push),  branch values EXCEPT the last commit are set to none.

This is easily reproduced by doing the following:

# Modify file1
# git add file1
# git commit -m "First commit"
# Modify file2
# git add file2
# git commit -m "Second commit"
# git push

The triggered email body content will show 2 new commits, the first of which will have a branch value as none. IF the above files were on master, only the last commit would have this value set.
fields.summary: Email Hook Branch Value Bug
Cancel P

fields.description:
h1. I've used google account for using Bitbucket.\\
Today, when I tried to login, the following message is shown.
Something went wrong.

h1. You can contact support or create a public issue if the problem persists.\\
This might be useful in debugging the problem:\\
a516acebc33d467181cd6d4cdb0cfe55\\
You can also visit our status page.
Before the above message appeared, I failed to login about three times. because I tried to login with username and password, not using oauth.

What should I going to do?
fields.summary: [Bitbucket] Google account login blocked

fields.description:
The status can be changed from the overview page of an issue, but not when editing an issue. So if I wanted to change it from "new" to "open" and at the same time assign it to someone I need to do that in two steps.

It would be nice to be able to do that in one step, which then also only creates one comment (and one "event").
fields.summary: Allow status to be changed when editing an issue (BB-9307)

fields.summary: New branch is created when editing files online in Mercurial repository

fields.description:
Apologies if this is a duplicate FR or existing function, but I didn't see anything relevant-looking in either [this Jira search|https://bitbucket.org/site/master/issues%3Fq%3Dwiki%2BHome] or the [bitbucket wiki docs|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BITBUCKET/Use%2Ba%2Bwiki]:

I'm writing a thesis/article as a set of wiki and code (git) repositories. I would like for the [top-level page of the top-level wiki|https://bitbucket.org/tlroche/aqmeii-na_n2o/wiki/Home] to have "the same" name/URI/title as the article. What I mean:

h1. name/URI
When I'm in [my profile|https://bitbucket.org/tlroche] and follow [the link to my top-level project|https://bitbucket.org/tlroche/aqmeii-na_n2o] and then follow [the link to its wiki|https://bitbucket.org/tlroche/aqmeii-na_n2o/wiki], I get forwarded to https://bitbucket.org/tlroche/aqmeii-na_n2o/wiki/Home . I'd prefer there was some way to instead make the top-level page of the wiki be, e.g., https://bitbucket.org/tlroche/aqmeii-na_n2o/wiki/Simulation_of_N2O_Production_and_Transport_in_North_America_Compared_to_Tower_Measurements . This would presumably also solve the titling problem.

h1. title
The top of [that top-level page|https://bitbucket.org/tlroche/aqmeii-na_n2o/wiki/Home] currently renders like the following ASCII-art:

{code}
Home
+---------------------------------------------
|Simulation of N2O Production and Transport in North America Compared to Tower Measurements
|table of contents
|...

{code}

I would prefer to see

{code}
Simulation of N2O Production and Transport in North America Compared to Tower Measurements
+---------------------------------------------
|table of contents
|...

{code}
fields.summary: allow renaming or retitling of wiki page=Home (BB-9313)

fields.description:
I have a wiki page

https://bitbucket.org/tlroche/aqmeii-na_n2o/wiki/Building_CMAQ-5.0.1

with headings/structure like

{code}
#!wikitext

**table of contents**
<<toc 3>>
= introduction
== run constraints
== building CMAQ
=== the old way to build CMAQ
=== a new way to build CMAQ
= strategy
= tactics
== identify stock CMAQ-5.0.1 build artifacts
== investigate an infinity build candidate
=== candidate build configuration
=== compare candidate to OAQPS build
= procedure

{code}

The body of the wiki page currently renders properly--particularly, each heading has the appropriate size--but the TOC currently renders like

{code}
* introduction
  * run constraints
  * building CMAQ
    * the old way to build CMAQ
    * a new way to build CMAQ
  * strategy
  * tactics
    * identify stock CMAQ-5.0.1 build artifacts
    * investigate an infinity build candidate
      * candidate build configuration
      * compare candidate to OAQPS build
    * procedure
{code}

which is incorrect. Note that I have reproduced the issue in greatly condensed form @ https://bitbucket.org/tlroche/issue_8152/wiki/Home : fee free to hack on that.
fields.summary: [creole] wiki TOC bullet levels don't match heading levels

fields.description: Created a repo named *follow* and when I click on it, nothing happens. I think it's now become the equivalent of the Follow button for my group.
fields.summary: Naming your repo "follow" makes that repo inaccessible.

fields.description:
Issues on the master repo have become increasingly clogged with worthless "+1" posts when users should just be using the vote feature instead of posting useless and disruptive comments. https://bitbucket.org/site/master/issue/2323/create-a-way-to-group-repositories is a prime example of this.

I'd like to suggest that issue comments beginning with '+1' be rejected and a message delivered to the user that they should use the "Vote" feature at the top of the issue unless they have something substantial to contribute to the conversation.
fields.summary: Disallow comments containing "+1" on issues.

fields.description: its nice to see all of the related commits (commits that refrenced an issue in their commit message) in issue page so we can determinate who commites on that issue and number of commits
fields.summary: list related commits in issue page

fields.description: ovo je samo mali test
fields.summary: Test

fields.description:
I love that BitBucket lets me upload unlimited repositories, but presently they all show up in one big list, and it's difficult to browse them all.  It'd be awesome if it were possible to tag (not to be confused with Mercurial tags) or categorize repositories and browse and filter these tags.

Some tags could even come from metadata, such as which language the repository is in - a page where I could see all my Java projects would be very useful, for instance.
fields.summary: Allow categorizing or tagging of repositories

fields.description:
We recently had an "event" (I'll describe details below) where a user apparently changed a branch pointer and unwittingly merged two code lines. Problem is, we do not have any idea who did this because Bitbucket only shows commit pushes and does not provide an audit trail of who/when/what anyone changes a branch pointer via

git push origin master:branch

Here is what happened in our case as best we can figure. Given: a "master" (i.e. trunk) code line and a "branch" code line that is a branch off of "master".

# Work is done on "branch", committed, and pushed to Bitbucket.
# User checks out "master", does a git merge branch, commits the merge, and pushes to Bitbucket
# Someone, we don't know who, sets the "branch" branch pointer to "master" - git push origin master:branch

At this point the two code lines have completely joined. We don't want the two to join because there are changes in "master" that must not be in "branch".

Ideally, we would like to prevent this kind of branch pointer manipulation altogether (I don't know how to codify this into a specific rule - there are cases where this kind of manipulation should be allowed...). If we cannot get that then we at least want to know who did this so as to correct the behavior - so at least some audit trail would be needed.
fields.summary: Provide either better branch management control or an audit trail of branch pointer changes (BB-9310)

fields.description: When transitioning an issue from 'new' to 'open', I want to be able to assign someone in the same step, rather than having to edit the issue separately.  I'm requesting that the Assignee field (including the 'Assign to me' link) be available in the 'Open issue' workflow.
fields.summary: Add ability to assign an issue in workflow

fields.description: See [BB-9269|https://bitbucket.atlassian.net/browse/BB-9269]
fields.summary: Fix user management -- needs to be more clear on where users are added either through groups or individual repos on 'Plans and Billing' (BB-9269)

fields.description: it would be very nice if we could have html rendering for files not called _whatever.rst_.  eg. [cram|https://bitheap.org/cram/] insists on having its files called _whatever.t_.  other than that, it's perfectly possible for cram tests to be valid reST, and mine are just that, see [hg-request-pull|https://bitbucket.org/roman.neuhauser/hg-request-pull/src/tip/tests%3Fat%3Ddefault].
fields.summary: Allow users to customize which renderer handles different paths/file extensions (BB-9311)

fields.description: Hi! There is a JS error. Please have a look at the screenshot.
fields.summary: Can't delete branch using bit bucket website

fields.description:
Can we please show closed branches with a different icon, like in TortoisHG?\\
Like this:

!https://bitbucket.org/site/master/issue-attachment/1568/site/master/1326882685.13/1568/closed_branch.jpg!
fields.summary: Use different icon for Closed Branch in Hg commits graph (BB-9305)

fields.description:
When creating or importing a repo with a name that exists, this error message is displayed:\\
"You already have a repository with this name."\\
It would be more efficient to also provide a link to that existing repo to offer a fast way to check if the repo are the same, and if so eventually sync or else
fields.summary: When creating or importing a repo with a name that exists, provide a link to that existing repo (BB-9312)

fields.description:
I'm experimenting setting up a custom domain for my projects, and when I click "Create" at the top of the page while on the custom domain, it redirects me to bitbucket.org, and doesn't redirect me back after the fact.

I notice that repository creation is https://, so presumably it's intentional that we're redirected to bitbucket.org during creation, but it'd be great if we were redirected back afterwards.

Related, but arguably not the same issue, going to http[s]://mycustomdomain/repo/create is a 404, rather than a HTTP redirect, and interestingly on _this_ page the create URL doesn't point to bitbucket.org, it points to the custom domain (and also 404s).
fields.summary: Creating a new repo while on a custom domain takes you to bitbucket.org (BB-9357)

fields.description:
Normally, I respond to resolved comments with a comment "Fixed". At other times, the commenter removes it. This is inconsistent and is a work-around for what comments could become.

Please allow comments to become tasks to be checked off. Display them differently and display an overall task resolution status on the pull request.
fields.summary: Give comments the ability to become tasks to check off (BB-9304)

fields.description: Bitbucket is mapping it's URLs into lower case. So the URL for My_Repo would be bitbucket.org/user_name/my_repo/, however when linked as a submodule the link is comming up as bitbucket.org/user_name/My_Repo and so is giving a 404. The submodules links within bitbucket need to be lower cased.
fields.summary: Submodule links for Git repositories including capital letter giving 404 (BB-9303)
